FuncDef:
The user-group command creates a user group.
The undo user-group command deletes an existing user group.
By default, no user group is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a user group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
User groups are used to control user access in different domains for ACL control. To control user access in different domains, run the user-group command to create a user group, configure a QoS policy for the user group, and run the user-group (AAA domain view) to bind the user group to a specific domain.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
A user group can be bound to multiple domains, but one domain can be bound to only one user group.
You cannot delete a user group that is not created.
